messages: 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:34): While what I'm about to say might be a taboo, have you people made a poll with the users on this channel about what they're currently using, be it RDFa or Microdata?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:34): Is it important to do so?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:35): Statistics are always important, whether you take them into account or not.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:35): Statistics of a random chat room probably aren't.  ^_^  Usage on the web is.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:36): Well, the poll would be about people using it.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:38): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e, you didn't even mention microformatting.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:38): That's like not including Google :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:38): Microformats are already part of HTML, though.  We're talking *dedicated* metadata embedding formats.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:38): Well, to be "impartial", let's include Microformatting, though I don't like it that much.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:38): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, well maybe everyone is okay with that.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:39): Besides, I guess usage shows a bigger RDFa user-base than Microdata, given their age.

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:40): Say 1000 people use one of those three; 300 use microdata, 200 use RDFa, and 500 use microformatting --- disregarding microformatting is strange --- because they're all trying to accomplish the same functionality.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:40): It's not like comparing people that don't do anything to people that do something --- you should try to include all popular "something"s.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:41): Hmm... though it's an example, you mention at least 300 people using Microdata. Has user-base really grown that much?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:41): I mean, in general.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:41): The internet is SERIOUS BUSINESS 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e!

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:45): In any case, Microformats are not defined by their embedding.  They're a structure to apply to data.  They happened to use an embedding method built around existing HTML4 syntax, because that's what was available at the time, but writing an hcard in Microdata or RDFa is still using Microformats.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:45): I guess in the end it's better to have multiple "supported" options, than to have one unsupported.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (20:46): That's kind of why I don't like Microformats.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:50): It's kinda what the class attribute was designed to do.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:51): Not that I'm against Microdata or RDFa, even though they kill unicorns.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:51): Well, yes and no.  Class isn't necessarily supposed to be communicating anything meaningful to the outside world.  It's meant for private communication between the page author and their tools.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:52): RDFa has nicer documention and adoption than Microdata IMHO.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:54): While I, on the other hand, find Microdata's overall syntax and data model to be immensely simpler and easier to write and read.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (20:56): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, I bet I would feel the same way if the documentation wasn't such a unrainbow.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:19): Oh, damn, wait... if not even Internet Explorer recognizes HTML5 elements (<header>, <section>, etc.), how can I make print stylesheets work? :o
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:20): The IE printing problem is a hard one.  If print stylesheets working in IE is important to you, don't use HTML5 yet.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:21): Internet Explorer 8*
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:22): Yeah. It's not a problem for MY website, but if I were to ever code a website for someone else, I guess I'd have to switch back to <div>.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:22): I think that most people don't actually care how websites print, so you're probably okay.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:23): IE can handle the new elements just fine on the screen, with the createElement hack.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:24): HTML5Shiv was a life-saver for a lot of people.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:24): Shiv the printer!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:24): AFAIK, no one's figured out how to.  ;_;
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:24): http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html5-experiments/phase-01.html http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html5-experiments/phase-02.html
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:26): Any blogs giving an example of how the html5 ie printing problem works?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:26): Maybe I can look into it.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:28): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132- None that I know of. :'(
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:29): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132- I'm going to (try to) check all your SandBox examples. http://sandbox.thewikies.com/
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:29): Don't judge me, brah.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:35): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132- Phase 02 images don't work.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:35): In Experiments, I mean.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:37): Is this alright?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:37): article, aside, figure, footer, header,hgroup, menu, nav, section {display: block;}
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:37): Am I missing anything?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:38): Check 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132's HTML default stylesheet.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:41): Hmm... where? I don't find it in the sandbox folder, not in the document's own CSS.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:43): I didn't bookmark it last time I saw it; ask 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (21:44): You mean http://www.iecss.com/whatwg.css ?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:45): Hmm, it's a reset stylesheet. Good, let's check it out.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:48): It specifies everything.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:49): Yes, it's meant to be an example of what an actual UA stylesheet for HTML5 could look like.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:49): UA means a browser?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:50): Yeah.  User Agent.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:50): User Agent, oh, yes.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:50): In this context, browser, but it can mean lots of things.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (21:50): should that include stuff like :valid, :invalid, :out-of-range, etc?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (21:51): or would that be handled elsewhere?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:51): HTML5 doesn't specify any default renderings for those.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (21:51): doesn't know
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (21:51): Hmm... and while this should provide a good example, is that CSS publicized so that UA developers know of it?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (21:51): yeah, gotcha 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (21:51): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: It's just a distillation of what HTML5 says, in a perhaps-more-understandable and centralized format.
